p: Sympatric populations of Cypripedium candidum and C. parviflorum were monitored every year from 1994 to 2014 in a wet alkaline meadow at Gavin Prairie Nature Preserve, northeastern Illinois, USA. One Ophrys population was monitored every year from 1975 to 2006 at Castle Hill National Nature Reserve, Sussex, England. Gavin Prairie is characterized by communities dominated by tallgrass and Quercus spp. in drier areas, and by Carex spp. with some Salix spp. in wetter, tussock-filled areas. The vegetation at Castle Hill is ancient sheep-grazed, species-rich, calcareous grassland. Further site details are provided by Shefferson et al. [ 39, 40] and Hutchings [ 38].
